website_summaries.verdict: Despite the low price, this stand is well built and convenient.
pros: While it's not as capable as a professional stand, this is an excellent bike repair stand for the price
The parts are well made and attractive, and the clamp works well, fitting tubes from 1" to 1.6" in diameter
Height adjusts from 42.5" to 74.8", and the stand weighs 17.6 lbs
cons: The screw to adjust the collar is tedious
Stand might swivel while you work

customer_reviews.title: Broke immediately.
customer_reviews.text: The collar that holds the vertical post broke immediately. The unit wasn't even holding the bike yet... I just tightened it one turn to hold the bar itself, and it snapped! I still gave it two stars since the rest off the unit seens pretty solid, but I now have to invent a way to fix it to use it for the first time. Cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Marple

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy! Solid
customer_reviews.text: This is my first bike work rack. I give it a 5 based on comparison w other racks (read) and upon visual inspection seen to be a well built bike work rack. Sturdy! Solid. And handles our road bikes securely well . The small tray is handy. I am concerned with the plastic parts may brittle after time or repeated use... The appearance and feel is structuraly sound, plus stowing it away in the corner is a no brainer and doesnt take much space- its a plus! So- for the features , solid feel, and perhaps as a "beginner" work rack And the price= it gets a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Erick O

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying if you are using it as a work stand
customer_reviews.text: This stand is only good for holding your bike to was or display it. I have a 2017 specialized stump jumper and if I clam to my seat post the stand swivels no matter how tight all of the clamps are. Even clamping to the frame, if I remove my front wheel the bike swivels backward.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for MTB
customer_reviews.text: This stand does not hold standard tube mountain bikes. The grip is not wide enough to clear the tube
customer_reviews.author: Trail dog in the desert

customer_reviews.title: Quality construction & easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I've used this stand several times now and each time I appreciate how effective it is at providing a stable platform for adjusting my brakes, adjusting the shifting mechanism, or just giving my bike a good wash .All the adjustment knobs tighten things down just right. I especially like the front wheel brace that is easy to attach to the handlebar and keeps the front wheel from rotating. The whole thing folds up into a compact unit that makes storage convenient and easy. Overall, I'm very pleased with this stand and highly recommend it for those who are looking for a very reasonably-priced work stand that will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Whippit

customer_reviews.title: Inferior components. Save up for a reputable company
customer_reviews.text: I used this product two times and the picture included shows the extension tube nut and bolt which stripped out, simply by hand tightening it. Again, I used this 2 times and it’s already broken. Save your money and buy aBike stand from a reputable company. This thing is worthless. Do not count on it to properly secure your expensive bike because it will not. You get what you pay for most times and this is a perfect example. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Doe

customer_reviews.title: No brainer.  I put this to the test and it passed.
customer_reviews.text: Any "elite" cyclist can probably pick anything apart so people need to ignore the nonsense and buy one of these. Doesn't matter if you are training for the tour de france or fixing your kids tire!! I have had my 17 lb. road bike in this and a 40 lb. mountain bike and no problems at all. Just for fun I spun the mountain bike around in the most awkward positions including cantilevers that should have crippled or at least toppled this stand and still to issue. Guess I'm sick like that but I needed to know if this thing could be counted on long term and so far I would say that it most certainly can.
customer_reviews.author: Peter G

customer_reviews.title: Stop reading and get one. Your back will thank you.
customer_reviews.text: As a 6'4" rider, I really should have bought this a long time ago. Saves my back, and also holds all my weird frame shaped bikes pretty easily. While it's low cost, it never feels cheap to me. Can be rightened to hold all of my bikes in any angle i'd actually use, even some weird ones, like 12-o-clock straight up and down. Not to sound like a fan boy, but damn, its true that this is the best single investment I've made in my bikes, and my back. My back breathed a sigh of relief the first day I used it and I pretty much won't touch my bike without putting it on the stand now a days.
customer_reviews.author: High Speed Cyclist

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stand, even if it was another $20 more
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, not a stand like a shop stand, but for portability and stoutness this stand works, I put a 32 pound box bike on this stand and it handled it just fine, no creaking or what not, held a 22 pound DH bike so well I could turn it upside down to do new headset cups. I like the 4 leg setup on this just make sure that's the first thing you lock down because I forgot and my bike dropped but the stand caught it before it hit the ground
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, with some headaches.
customer_reviews.text: It does the job, but I have a few complaints. First the hand screw used to clamp the bike in is tedious to use compared with other stands. Second, no matter how tight you get the crossbar, the torque is enough to swivel the bike back to its center of gravity. Third, the blue rubber pieces on the bike clamp come off very easily. Finally, the tool tray is I. An awkward place. You have to reach through the bike to get your tools. I can do what I need, but it's a pain. I'll probably invest in a more expensive stand soon.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Smith

customer_reviews.title: Probably would not work for a shop - but for novice - great choice. I purchased a bike on-line that needed ...
customer_reviews.text: Bike stand works exactly as described. Well made. Probably would not work for a shop - but for novice - great choice. I purchased a bike on-line that needed assembling and ordered the stand for that job. Easy to assemble, stable, holds bike firmly in place in various positions and made the job SO much easier. Thought about selling it once bike was assembled but I am keeping it as using a stand ALMOST makes working on my bike enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: M. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Well engineered stand. Comparable to stands that are $250...
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I’ve owned probably 10 high end bike stands over my racing career and I can honestly say, this one is a good as any I’ve owned at 20% of the cost. I’m really impressed. Really.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: A good deal for the money, but if you have a heavier bike, go with a stronger built stand.
customer_reviews.text: The bike rack works pretty well, and is a good deal for the price. Unfortunately, some of the bracing and clamping components are made of hard plastic, and don’t hold the bike up very well (the whole bike will tip to one side. Furthermore, when I put my heavier full suspension bike up, the whole stand seemed unstable, like it was about to tip over, and the plastic pieces were bowing. Also, the rubber protectors on the gripping mechanism keep falling off, which can be frustrating when trying to clamp your bike on.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: For the money, this stand does everything I need it to do
customer_reviews.text: I know some reviewers complain that doesn't seem as durable as it should, but you really can't compare this to a several hundred dollar professional bike stand. For those who need to get the wheels off the ground to work on the chain, derailleurs, brakes, etc., you can't beat its functionality for the price. I like that it can easily fold up and be out of the way, or it can remain set up if you have the space for easy bike on/off access.
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: I like to tune it up every so often and I ...
customer_reviews.text: I ride my bike maybe 20 or 30 times a year. I have a Trek 1.1. I like to tune it up every so often and I was doing it by balancing it upside down on my deck with the tire propped up against the hand railing. I can say truthfully that this stand is a much better way of tuning up a bike. I don't know what a more expensive bike stand gives you but I honestly don't care since I really don't ride that often, and I really don't have to tune up that often. The stand feels solid and it holds the bike in place. Can't ask for more than that.
customer_reviews.author: Bert Honeyfellow

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt stay in place
customer_reviews.text: I have a light weight aluminum small frame mountain bike. It doesn't hold it in place no matter how tight I make it. Its better then no stand at all so if it being off balanced doesnt bother you, it will do the job. It keeps it off the ground; i just have to hold my bike when trying to work on the front of my bike.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Great bike stand!
customer_reviews.text: I used this stand so many times for my repairs on 3 bikes. It is strong and sturdy. Easy to set up and portable. The quality is solid. The value is nice. I highly recommend. Every bike owner should have a stand as it makes repairs much easier.
customer_reviews.author: BAH

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's a great value. The steel structure feel solid and should last forever. A little worried about the plastic connectors holding the steel pieces. I've seen them crack unexpected after several years of use. I've had some problems with holding the bike in a 45° position. Having a plastic connector trying to prevent a smooth painted surface from spinning is pretty difficult when trying to tighten a small handle with oily hands.
customer_reviews.author: Yum Yum

customer_reviews.title: Solid, sturdy, useful
customer_reviews.text: I wish I'd had this years ago. It's the only way to do justice to bike maintenance. This unit is easy to assemble, and provides a solid stand for getting your bike's wheels above ground so you can shift gears, clean the chain, and perform any number of bike maintenance techniques.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Kahn

customer_reviews.title: it works for standard bikes, but it's not the sturdiest
customer_reviews.text: My standard round tube bike fits in the head clamp fine, BUT, if you don't get it centered perfectly, the bike will rotate or swing. the top clamp that keeps the clamp from rotating doesn't tighten enough and lets the the bike swing down. Get it balanced and it works pretty well. Now my new carbon bike has larger tubes and don't fit at all so the stand is useless...
customer_reviews.author: M. Quick

customer_reviews.title: It is saving me money and making me better at repairs
customer_reviews.text: This was my first bike stand, but I have already have used it more thqan I thought I would and love what it does for me. It is easy to set up and then put away in a small corner. The stand is lightweight yet heavy enough to do a good job. It is easy to adjust and makes bike repairs much simpler and easy to accomplish. I have informally worked on bikes for years and just recently decided to do it more professionally. This was an invaluable start to that process and I am already doing things (wheel spoke adjustments and the like) that I used to send to the bike shop.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Bouchelle

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a “cheap” stand that I could use at home or possibly take with me to a mtb park. This stand has a solid feel and holds my heavy DH no problem. This is going to make life easier to work on now. It was packaged well, no missing parts, and was ready to go in minutes. Sadly, I did my wife’s 1x10 conversion without this stand and it sucked big time.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Tsa

customer_reviews.title: Great quality overall but one major flaw
customer_reviews.text: The stand is great and really well built with one major exception. The arm that connects to the handlebar has plastic tabs where you are supposed to clip the hook into, well, they are both made out of plastic and one of them arrived broken and now another one broke after third use. I am keeping it in place with zipties since returning this is too much of a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: When first received, was very pleased with stand and worked very well for simple bike maintenance. Good price point for me. After about 6 uses, the clamp that holds the bike frame broke. The stand itself is very nice, but the important parts are plastic and now I have a useless piece of junk. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Tortoise

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, versatile, well-made bargain work stand
customer_reviews.text: It easily holds my very heavy electric mountain bike, even without removing the heavy battery. This stand is very stable, has a few nice features like the handle-bar stabilizing arm, tool tray, and multiple adjustments, as well as soft grip clamps to not mark up my frame. It's proven to be a darn good stand, at easily half the price (or less) than many brand name stands out there.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Fanatic in SoCal

customer_reviews.title: LIGHT bikes only.
customer_reviews.text: Works okay for LIGHT bikes. I have a heavier 55lbs mountain bike. And this thing is simply not up to the task. It makes working on my bike a total headache because it's always sliding around and drooping, I wouldn't recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get a Better One
customer_reviews.text: It'll get you by. I've had mine for s little over seven months now and the plastic clamping parts are failing. Today the hight adjustment clamp broke. You're better off spending more for higher quality necessary I promise with these assembly parts you're throwing $50 away.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Poole

customer_reviews.title: Solid, flexible, well-made stand; zero manufacturer contact information
customer_reviews.text: I do my own routine and light to moderate bicycle maintenance at home. The Yaheetech stand is solidly constructed throughout and flexible for my uses. It is not small but the legs fold up making it easy to carry in my hatchback. It is heavier than I expected reinforcing my sense of its solidness. The only thing I would complain about is that while it arrived with clear assembly instructions, there is zero information about its manufacturer, how to contact them, how to get parts, etc: zero, zilch, nada. Are they more than an Amazon storefront?
customer_reviews.author: Bob M.

customer_reviews.title: STOP paying the bike shop money and buy this.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not one to write reviews on items but I had to with this. Just put this together and hug my bike form it. If you are one of those riders that is getting feed up on paying the Bike Shop to fix their screwups, then you must Buy this stand. Lean how to work on your own bike and use this stand. It is well built and very sturdy. I have seen the bike shops stand and can't tell the difference. This arrived on time, was easy to put together and so far I'm very impressed. Save money BUY this Stand and lean how to work on your own bike. Ward Fulmer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seemed OK But Missing Tool Tray
customer_reviews.text: When I put the stand together it seemed adequate but unfortunately the package did not include a tool tray. I returned it to Amazon and opted to buy a Zeny, which was $15 less than the Yaheetech and has proved to be just as sturdy. So, nothing wrong with the Yaheetech but a little shopping found an equivalent for less money.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Willie

customer_reviews.title: Been fixing up my bikes and getting running better than I could when trying to work with them ...
customer_reviews.text: Been fixing up my bikes and getting running better than I could when trying to work with them on the ground. Makes working on them so much easier. And you can find more problems than you can if the bikes sits on the ground. Makes adjusting the derailleur's on the front and rear of your bike. Plus you are able to look done the cassette and over the chain to line things up. Once you get it into the sweat spot your gears switch like butter! Here's my eMTB up on it and a few other lighter bikes I've worked on. My new eMTB weighs around 45 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: jade razor

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome (caveat, I am using it for a bow vice/work stand, not for a bike)
customer_reviews.text: I cannot actually review this for working on bikes. I use it to do my own bow work (compound archery). I had someone make an attachment for it to connect to my bow and this stand works excellently, the only thing that isn't stock is the part that holds the bow, the rest is. Solid, very sturdy, portable, and good quality
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great stand and great price
customer_reviews.text: This makes cleaning or working on your bike a breeze. It will hold my lightweight road bikes and my heavy mountain bike no problem. Easy set up. No issues. The things I do not like are: the arm to joke your front wheel in place is not reliable. I don't even try anymore. Still works for what I am doing. Also, the clamp to the bike is finicky. Be careful making sure it is secure.
customer_reviews.author: PeaPodBooks

customer_reviews.title: Great stand for the money
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with this stand. The only issue I have with it is that there isn't a quick release for the clamp that holds the bike. You have to twist it open and closed. Not a deal breaker though. The clamp rubber pieces fall off a lot but you can just super glue them. Everything else about it is made with quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your bucks!
customer_reviews.text: It's strong enough to hold my 37lb hybrid bike by the saddle post. I love that you can adjust the legs fully out or a little closed depending on the amount of room you have.
customer_reviews.author: PapiDay

customer_reviews.title: It is light and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: It is light and easy to assemble. However, while trying to tighten the clamping mechanism to keep my bike from slipping in the stand, the plastic cracked and no longer holds tight at all. I'm certainly glad that I bought it at a marked down price because it was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Rankin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together and does what it says it will
customer_reviews.text: Very nice stand for working on your bike. Easy to set up to use, or collapse to store. Impressed with the simple operations but it does what you need to get your bike in place for maintenance work. Comes with a stabilizer bar for front wheel / fork as well. Definitely pleased with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Been there, tried that

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Works great for regular bike maintenance. I am building e-bikes and do all the work on the stand and put the motor on when the bike is on the ground. It holds the weight as advertised but if you are building an e-bike don't push the weight limit to far. Good product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Grobe

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought this years ago
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It is more sturdy and stable than I expected at this price. It is well constructed and seems that it will out last me. I originally bought it for a total upgrade (everything except the frame). Now I place my bike back on it at the end of each ride. It is very stable and I know my bike won't get knocked over.
customer_reviews.author: RussTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Easy. Sturdy. Adjustable. No regrets.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to put together. Holds my Trek X Cal 8 29er just fine. Used it to changed the front derailleur, switch back tire to tubeless, and index rear derailleur last night with no issues at all. Nice range of adjustment up and down as well as rotation. Took tray is a bit small but comes in handy when dealing with small nuts and bolts so they don’t run off. Would definitely buy again. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: McHargue

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and use
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and easy to understand how to use it. I want to do as much of the cleaning and repair work on my bike as possible and this stand is perfect for me. I'm 5'4" and like that I was able to adjust the stand height to be able to lift my step-through bike up to the holder.. I assembled it with little help from the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Trust the reviews-this stand is great!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this thanks to my fellow reviewers. I didn't have the $$ for the Park Tools stand so went on the hunt for a more affordable option. Stand is great! Legs splay out over a large area, which is fine for my space. Nice and sturdy. The tool tray is really handy and just large enough. Big plus is the small size it packs down to-like a taller tripod. Great for my small house. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: AustinsMom

customer_reviews.title: Great bike stand for home maintenance/ repairs
customer_reviews.text: Great entry stand. Good value. Quality build. Worst thing that happens is the blue rubber "L"s slip off a little, no biggie. Glue em if it bothers you. I used this stand to build an electric bike. Held it high or low when I needed it. Easy to adjust. That ebike weights about 52lbs so it's sturdy. Just make sure you have a big enough flat space on the ground for the feet. It's pretty wide base.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S

customer_reviews.title: It is not very sturdy and the clamp that attaches to the bike is ...
customer_reviews.text: It is not very sturdy and the clamp that attaches to the bike is kinda weak. I had another stand that I sold when I moved because I wasn't sure on how much space I would have. Then decided to buy this one a few months later....... I wish I kept the other stand. This one is decent for the price but I would spend another 30 or 40 bucks and get something better and be done with it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Nice stand. But not durable
customer_reviews.text: I barely use this stand but its handy when used. It sits unused 90 percent of the time. I ordered on May 2018. Yesterday I took it out of storage and noticed the tightening knob that holds the bike was split in half. I was not happy. I will contact Amazon to see if they can do something about it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Best budget bike repair stand I’ve seen
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome, held up my steel frame Scott Unitrack through an entire group set swap with not even a creak and it’s a heavy bike. For the price there is nothing on the market that I’ve seen is better.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S Costa

customer_reviews.title: Crazy Value For A Bike Repair Stand
customer_reviews.text: Quadropod opens very wide at the bottom meaning it is very stable. I found the hardware to be solid and secure. Big beefy knobs and solid intermediate weight tubing. No problems with the product double boxed during shipping. Easily worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Hotlayout

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Stand works awesome and is very stable. Beefy but lightweight. Holds my bikes perfectly for maintenance. I got so sick of turning my bike upside down to work on it. The front wheel stabilizer and tool tray are welcome bonuses.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: look no more, this is the same thing but for half the price
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so I've been looking for a repair rack for awhile, and there's hundreds out there. So after sorting through them all I stumbled apon this one. All the others were $120 and above, so i figured id try this for half the price, and i wasn't disappointed!! No need to spend over $100 on a name brand.. This stand is absolutely great and its all you need, the little tool rack that attaches to it is awesome and makes for a great little space to put your tools and such while your working on your bike. There is absolutely no need to look anymore for a repair stand, this is the one!!
customer_reviews.author: Joey c.

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: This stand is great in almost every way. Folds up easy and is solid overall. The shelf is nice with a magnetic strip to keep the tools in place. My only gripe is the stabilizer pole to keep the handle bars still is really flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: Great bike stand! Perfect for cleaning, storage, etc.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to store my mountain bike in my garage. It is permanently holding the weight of my bike up and it has not collapsed under the weight of my bike. I also use it for cleaning both of by bikes and I don't have any real complaints. Setup was cake. Took me all of probably 10-15 minutes. Comes mostly assembled, all you really need to do is put a couple poles together and then bolt the accessory tray on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was pretty impressed with this stand
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty impressed with this stand. It is sturdy and seems quality and well out together. Used it to clean my wife and my mountain bikes after a ride. Was easy to out together and folds up pretty easily. I'd buy it again and recommend to a friend. Bought it as a Christmas present for myself
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy, just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Very Sturdy, just what I needed. Can't be beat for the money. My bike is very heavy, Fat Tire eBike, 60-70lbs
customer_reviews.author: ATDM

customer_reviews.title: It's fine. It has a hard time keeping the bike ...
customer_reviews.text: It's fine. It has a hard time keeping the bike from rotating unless perfectly balanced. If you tighten it really hard to stop movement, it is extremely difficult to loosen. Other than that, it works fine I guess.
customer_reviews.author: EsQueue

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Sturdy and very secure. It held my XL Fathom 2 fine.. highly recommend. I clamped it on the top frame post too even though it's not round and the clamp worked well in it too.
customer_reviews.author: Phil H.

customer_reviews.title: Boy, this really saves my back
customer_reviews.text: Boy, this really saves my back. The wife will even let me put this next to the tv when I am working on my bike. It's not super strong but I am not trying to spin my bike around or hold it in a funny angle. But you can move it off the floor and work on any part of the bike standing up.
customer_reviews.author: DTB

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight easy to move recommend
customer_reviews.text: as described, bought as gift for 13 yr old, he easily assembled it himself and moves it around from house to house as needed. so it’s not aweful heavy or that awkward to move. He picked it out and said it’s best bike stand kids in area have seen
customer_reviews.author: Miss Renai

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded my expectations. I decided to refurbish my "vintage" bike, wanted a bike stand but didn't want to pay a whole lot. Reviews on this one were pretty good so I took a shot. Out of the box I was impressed, much more solidly built than I was expecting with nice, thick wall tubing. Holds the bike well in a variety of positions. I found that I had to crank down pretty hard on the clamping handles to keep things from rotating but didn't have any problems once I did. The tool tray and handle bar stabilizer are nice accessories. Overall, a really good value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Standing up to it
customer_reviews.text: I have a new bike that I love and so wanted a rack to facilitate weekly cleaning. This rack does everything I wanted. When it arrived, the bulky size of the box hinted a lot of assembly, but, no, it was simply wrapped greatly and was up and working in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F. Karlovits

customer_reviews.title: Solid stand for bike maintenance and repairs
customer_reviews.text: Great value! Received the stand and ups assembling it I found a locking bracket had spit. The seller responded very quickly, confirmed the part number and shipped the replacement immediately . Great product and customer service!
customer_reviews.author: R. Brouwer

customer_reviews.title: For once it was peaceful, in the garage!
customer_reviews.text: This was just perfect! Came in quickly and no damage. My Boys can work on the bikes without any worries. No need to hold the bike in place anymore and no arguments about 'you dropped it, or hold on tight! It was peaceful in the garage. I truly hope it withstands the handling.
customer_reviews.author: Lubella

customer_reviews.title: Just got it it looks good. I don't like that it has some plastic ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got it it looks good. I don't like that it has some plastic parts. Especially the clamp that's hold the bike. But it is holding. I think it's a good deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Quinonez

customer_reviews.title: It Makes Life Better(well, at least the bike repair part)
customer_reviews.text: One guy said it isn't like the one at your local bike shop. Uh.. no it wouldn't be. However, it allows me to take wheels off, check gears,lube the chain,etc.. without turning my bike upside down on the handlebars. That's enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Rommel Upshur

customer_reviews.title: don't strain your back
customer_reviews.text: this repair stand holds your bike at any height and at any angle. if you ride then you need this bike stand
customer_reviews.author: bbunt1056

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, surprisingly sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: This was the cheapest stand available at the time and I am very impressed at how good it is for the money. Absolutely perfect for the occasional user on a budget. My bike isn't very light but the stand held it no problem. I can't see why anyone would buy any other stand for occasional, home use.
customer_reviews.author: MR B H BURROWES

customer_reviews.title: Great stand
customer_reviews.text: Great stand for the money, sturdy and dependable so far. I've built a few bike in ity and rebuilt a few in it. Still going strong. I am careful how I use it, remember it does have plastic componets.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Clamp pole isn’t strong enough
customer_reviews.text: The stand looks firm and strong but I have a 29” Kent ds Flexor Custom but the stand never holds my bicycle in place. Whenever I place my bicycle on the clamp it rotates clockwise as it the pole that is holding the clamp for the bicycle isn’t tight enough.
customer_reviews.author: Ras

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need it to
customer_reviews.text: I haven't owned any other bike stands before and decided to get one to change tires easier. I'm not into professional bike repair and just wanted something that wouldn't break the bank to hold my bike up to change tires/tubes and other small maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Peshman

customer_reviews.title: Not that great.
customer_reviews.text: Its ok, but not that sturdy. Look elsewhere if you want the best. If you want just barely good enough than this fits the bill..
customer_reviews.author: Brian N

customer_reviews.title: a third and fourth hand when you need it.
customer_reviews.text: I like to change things on my bicycle but I was always needing someone else to help which is a hassle. With this stand you can do the work or even take a coffee break while thinking about how you want to proceed, it does not complain nor does it fail to hold your bike. I like it !!!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald M.

customer_reviews.title: Great stand for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the money I was pretty impressed with this stand. It's surprisingly sturdy, and simple to use. It has a few plastic parts that I know I'll have to be careful with, but for occasional use I expect it to do well for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product.
customer_reviews.text: Unboxed easily, assembled easily, holds my 60 pound Mongoose steady and allows me to do anything I need to do using both hands while the Bike is held stable, AND I am sitting... no back pain.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Biker

customer_reviews.title: Clamp threads flattened
customer_reviews.text: Have had this stand for a couple of years and it's a decent beginner stand. The metal screw on the top has flat spots on it threads after moderate use so I can no longer tighten the clamp onto a seat post. The little blue plastic pieces also fall off quite often when the clamp is turned vertical.
customer_reviews.author: Azuremed

customer_reviews.title: this product is a good quality item
customer_reviews.text: Do not let the other reviews fool you, this product is a good quality item. Not pro-grade but for the high-end enthusiast this should take care of. I ha mounted my all composite frame as well as the low-end (heavy!) street bikes with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome
customer_reviews.text: It works great. I wish the tool tray was different or able to move better. Also the lock that holds the feet extended is annoying to pop, why have that and the twist lock.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Wow, very happy.
customer_reviews.text: Have you ever made a purchase and smiled when you opened the box? That happened to me when I opened the box and saw what a great purchase I had made. Don't see how the seller makes money by selling these stands at such a low price. This is a quality product, and you will be very happy if you purchase one for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality vs Price Winner
customer_reviews.text: This was priced the lowest of the bike racks that I could find. Even though it was priced the lowest, I am not finding a faults with it. It appears to be sturdy and long-lasting. Therefore, I give it 5 stars based on a comparison between looks, function, and price.
customer_reviews.author: g

customer_reviews.title: Great Work Area for Bike
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my husband as a Christmas gift, and he loves it. Had to wrap a cloth around bike frame and his cross bar is an odd shape, but makes it easy to work on bike.
customer_reviews.author: Laken Mader

customer_reviews.title: Super durable
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this for a little over a month and used it so far to build a commuter bike, tune up my gravel bike and tune up a fast bike. This thing can hold a lot of weight and position your bike in an unlimited amount of positions. The tool tray is a nice feature as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for occasional use.
customer_reviews.text: This worked for me to work on my hybrid bike. I adjusted the gears and put on new brake pads. It is fine for occasional use. The plastic on the main clamp worries me but if taken care of and used with care, it should be alright. I will post updates when I work on my Mountain bikes. Wide legs make a very solid base.
customer_reviews.author: genius

customer_reviews.title: Hi
customer_reviews.text: Product is great. On delivery I opened the box and found the base was broken bummer! I contacted the seller and right away the responded and resolved the issue shipped out a replacement. Overall good product I like it to bleed my bikes brakes and it’s easy to clean the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: My son love this repair stand. It gives him more flexibility to not only work on the tires, but brakes, chain, etc. now he’s helping his friends work on their bikes as well! Def recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Martinez

customer_reviews.title: but for the money it works great! I have used it on a variety of ...
customer_reviews.text: It's not a park, but for the money it works great! I have used it on a variety of bikes Mtn and road. No more bending over for this guy, A well made product. Perfect for that do it yourself type of guy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For me this is enough
customer_reviews.text: Beats bending over or sitting on the ground. When I get something I usually start with something cheap and decide if I want something better. This is good enough and stable. I have bikes that are under 35 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: For the Price you can't go wrong...and it works!
customer_reviews.text: Great bicycle repair stand for the price...for the price it would be hard to find anything better..adjusts to fit all my bikes...stable, handy front wheel stabilizer...tool tray...collapsible to save space. Cool. Peace.
customer_reviews.author: Dwain A.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Value
customer_reviews.text: SUPER easy to put together and holds the bike very well. Stable base (adjustable) and completely customizable to fit your bike.
customer_reviews.author: Tobe Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Solid, surprised for the price
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly solid setup. Folds compact, stays in place. The "handlebar strap" arrived broken, but it's not really a useful piece if you angle the bike right on the stand anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Jasonandkristy

customer_reviews.title: this stand is excellent. Four legs are very stable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve worked on bikes all my life, but never owned a stand for working on them. For my purposes, this stand is excellent. Four legs are very stable, and working on bikes is so much easier now. Makes adjusting brakes and gears an enjoyable experience. I’m sure this stand is probably inferior to a professional stand, but for my purpose, it is perfect and the price was awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! The stand is sturdy and was very easy to assemble ( I am not mechanically gifted). I've used the stand to clean and work on my bike without issue (stays in place and supports bike well). I would recommend this product, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: good value but not the strongest stand
customer_reviews.text: good value but not the strongest stand. light duty. wont hold up heavier bikes well. not packaged well....had minor damage during shipping. will work if you are gentle with it
customer_reviews.author: mg

customer_reviews.title: Good stand
customer_reviews.text: I love my new yaheetech pro mechanic stand it works great holding my specialized hard rock cromo upright I'm 511 & this stand even can hold the bike high enough that the bottom bracket is at my chest lv the only thing it doesn't do well is hold the bike sideways but I don't know why you would want to I would gladly buy this bike stand again if it ever brakes
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Used all summer no issues... for the price it is great!
customer_reviews.text: I have used my bicycle repair stand now for 3 months with no issues. It's not nearly as heavy duty as a professional stand but for the residential bicyclist it seems to be fine. None of my bikes weigh over 30 pounds but I am sure it would be fine for bikes up to 40lb.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Back Saver
customer_reviews.text: I am rebuilding an old bike that I've had for years. it's great to have a tool that will hold the bike steady off the ground while I remove, clean, and reinstall components. It securely clamps onto the bike's frame and holds in any position and at any height that I need.
customer_reviews.author: John Glendening

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 2 cycle equipment.
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought it to work on Stihl line trimmers and edgers. Bought it because it will clamp a 1” shaft. It’s Perfect for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Krinke

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it already
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing for the price! I can't keep the bike at strange angles without strategic use of the telescopic bar. Tough fit for custom built, wide bar full suspension mtn. bikes, but a little maneuvering can make it work. Saves my back. I'd buy again in a heart beat.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Very nice stand
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and we'll made, it is actually much nicer and better quality than I expected for the price. I highly recommend their then home bike mechanic
customer_reviews.author: NW Fisherman

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Love this stand makes working on bike much easier you don't bend over as much a lot easier on the back it makes it enjoyable highly recommend stand for anyone who likes to keep their bike clean and maintained I use this for my ebike that weighs easily 120 lbs maybe more (it's a tank ) very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Jon P.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great stand. Able to adjust it in many areas if need be. It’s able to hold my mtb, cycling, single speed and hard tail so I can easy do maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: C&S

customer_reviews.title: A surprisingly stable stand
customer_reviews.text: I recently assembled and used this for the first time. It is easy to assemble and once assembled, is ready for use in seconds. It is remarkably sturdy and stable and allowed me to properly index my rear gears without any problem. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: James Houghton

customer_reviews.title: Just get it
customer_reviews.text: For how cheap this stand was its actually nice. If you dont beat on the thing it will last. So far I have used it everyday this last month.
customer_reviews.author: William atwodd

product_meta.title: Yaheetech Pro Mechanic Bicycle Repair Workshop Stand Foldable Maintenance Rack w/ Tool Tray Height Adjustble Extensible Bike Repair Rack for Road & Mountain Bikes
feature_bullets: ▷High-quality materials: Our Bicycle Repair Stand is made of sturdy and high-quality iron and PA. It is sturdy and stable. It can carry up to 66 pounds (30 kg), which is enough to support your bicycle;

▷360° swivel clip: 360 degree swivel clip of the Bike Repair Stand allows your bike to be held in any position, two pivots and height adjustments provide maximum flexibility. It has rubber material, so it will protect your bicycle's paint very well.

▷Frame size: The telescopic bracket can be adjusted from 42. 5" to 74. 8" (1. 08-1. 9 m), so you can work on all parts without bending your waist adjustable clips are suitable for bicycle tubes of different diameters,
▷Rugged frame: The heavy-duty structure and 4-legged base of the Bike Stand securely support and grab the bike, making it easier to repair and clean your bike.
▷Free tool tray: Equipped with brackets to keep your tools organized and suitable for various repairs or assemblies;

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
